page.title: 06Provision of needs
page.content: A large proportion of housewives has access to a car and much shopping is done in Gloucester,sometimes as bulk purchases from the supermarkets with storage in home freezers.Roadside stalls sell fruit and vegetables in season and pick-your-own fruit farms supply what the local gardens and orchards haven't produced.A small post office/general grocery serves the area along with a family-owned small abbatoir/butchery business and a nearby public house.For other requirements people travel to neighbouring villages or small towns and to public houses along the side roads.Several people keep hens or ducks as a money-spinner,for household needs or for pleasure.Goats,horses,ponies,cats and dogs also form part of the home background.
